BOM JOGO!

Un juego de puzzles donde debemos usar nuestro razonamiento e inteligencia para completarlos, recomendable tener bastante paciencia para jugarlo (si es la primera vez que lo juegas) los puzzles pueden llegar a ser bastantes complicados u confusos y tendremos que usar mas la cabeza, en algunas cámaras podremos atascarnos pero lo mas importante es tener paciencia al hacerlas. Sobre la historia, esta es bastante buena y llega a tener sus momentos memorables. Recomendado para aquellos fans de la primera entrega u juegos de puzzles en general.
This is one of the best games ever made. It still holds up extremely well ever 9 years later.

Просыпаешься через 500 лет после первой части и идешь на поиски выхода и тортиков, по путм встречаешь круглого дружка, который из за своей тупости оживляет глэдос, а сам чуть не умерает и вот ты уже потеряв все шансы на спасение молча проходишь камеры, одну за одной и тут оказывается, что наш дружек не умер, идем за ним не видясь на тупые уловки глэдос, засовываем глэдос в кортошку и на её место подключаем дружка. Тут ты думаешь что прошел игру, но **й там плавал, этот дружок получив силу, решил, что ему будет скучно и скинул нас на дно лаборатории с картошкой глэдос (пока мы поднимались на вверх, он строил испытания, которые мы без труда проходим) и вот мы приходим в центр управление дружком, получаем бомбай по е*алу, стреляем портал на луну, держимся за дружка и оказываемся с ним в открытом космосе, отпускаем дружка, тебя вытаскивает глэдос, благодарит и отпускает на волю, конец.
Зае*умба

Прекрасная игра, затягивающая с самого начала неповторимой атмосферой и захватывающей механикой порталов. Сюжет достаточно хороший, присутствует «второй сюжет», который разберёт только внимательный игрок. [b]10 поющих турелей из 10.[/b]

After 9 years of this game being out, it still great fun. I keep coming back every couple of years just to relive the experience. The co-op in this game is also really fun. Both single player and co-op stories have a ton of content as well as a heap of easter eggs. Even better is the level editor and steam workshop, leaving you with basically infinite content. If you still don't have this game I absolutely recommend picking it up, either now or next time it goes on sale.
H

Everything in this game works perfectly. It's honestly baffling how entertaining, clever, atmospheric, and downright hilarious this game is. The Single Player is so great, and it feels like just the right length to maximize the enjoyability of the game (Even though I could play a game like this that's 10 times as long.) The co op is super fun and even supports local co op so you can play when you have a friend over. The community test chambers are also really fun and can keep you entertained for even longer. Steam says I only have 18 hours in this but from playing offline on family trips I must be at somewhere around 50 hours. If you haven't played this game you absolutely should its so well made and the characters will stick in your mind for a long time.

Best game ever. The perfect synthesis of what Valve does best: world-building, physics/environment-based puzzles, great story, great voice-acting, and it's just plain fun. 

The game is huge; it's 2.5x the size of the original portal in the single-player alone, and then you get another several hours worth of co-op play after that. Then there is the workshop with all the user created maps, of which there are some fantastic creations. Everybody, no matter their game tastes, should play Portal 2. Period. And if you play it knowing the basic Portal and Half-Life stories, then you get easter eggs galore as well.

전작도 너무 재밌게 했었는데

전작을 뛰어넘는 이거는 갓겜 그 이상의 초갓겜.

스테이지의 퍼즐의 난이도는 더 높아졌지만, 그렇다고해서 못깨먹을 정도로 높냐, 그건 아님. 거기에 깨는 방식도 다양하게 접근할 수 있어서 N회차 플레이도 충분히 가능한 갓겜.

더구나 멀티용 협동모드까지 있으니 더더욱 갓겜이라 할 수 있다.

이제 이 겜이 나온지도 어느새 10년이 다되가는데

아직도 이 겜을 틀면서 하면 10년전의 그 충격이 다가옴.

추천 또 추천하는 명작 갓겜.

Although I've already beaten the game in the span of 8 hours total, I love this game. I've played most of the first one and it wasn't too interesting to me, but the sequel sure as hell improves on it greatly. As with most puzzle games, there were of course a few parts where I got stuck and had no idea what to do, but when I found out, it made me feel like an idiot for not knowing in the first place. The ending (which I won't spoil the ending for a game that's almost 10 years old, by the way) was a cool nod to the lore of the facility and how the science was conducted. The game has a nice sense of humor too, even coming from minor characters like the turrets. The one that made me crack up the most was definitely Cave Johnson's rant about combustible lemons.

I'm surprised I haven't played this game until only recently, and if anyone reads this, I highly recommend it for those who love puzzle games, but want it to be in the form of a first-person shooter type game for some strangely specific reason. Either way, play it.
